noun.description: An official ban on trade or other commercial activity with a particular country.

verb.description: Impose an official ban on (trade or a country or commodity)
examples: the country has been virtually embargoed by most of the noncommunist world

verb.description: Seize (a ship or goods) for state service.

origin: Early 17th century: from Spanish, from embargar arrest, based on Latin in- in, within + barra a bar.
